data.title: Excellent hamburger
data.text: The looks of this place may be a turn off, but the food is excellent; one of the best hamburgers I have EVER eaten. Some of our group ordered salads and they looked fantastic. The in-house baked cheesecake was excellent with some unique offerings.

data.title: Time for a little something new
data.text: Unbelievable burgers that are just to the left of typical. The owner (and chef) loves to play with his food so be sure to check out the specials board. Oh, and don't let the exterior fool you. This place is one of the best in town!

data.title: Great late night food
data.text: I have ever had many things on the menu... From breakfast to burgers everything is always fantastic and fresh. Great place and great food. Add pork belly to a burger... Delicious!

data.title: Love this place
data.text: I love going to Mid City Grill the food is so good the burgers are thick and so good and the fries are perfect. If you are out late at night I highly recommend this place.

data.title: Awesome food
data.text: This place has the biggest burgers i have ever seen and awesome taste. The cheese cake is the best around and so many different kinds. You get plenty of food you shouldn't leave hungry. Friendly people to deal with.

data.title: Best Burgers in Town
data.text: For some reason it's hard to find a decent burger no matter where you're at. I don't understand it. Make it big, greasy, cheesy and bacony (is that a word?) and you've got a winner. Mid City does just that. Also, their in house made cheesecakes are some of the best I've tasted. They have several favors daily to choose from. This is no fancy restaurant by any means, but don't let the appearance fool you. It's he best burger you'll eat in the Tri-Cities.

data.title: Good Local Burger Joint
data.text: Stopped in here with some buddies for a guys night out. This was my first time here and I was pleasantly impressed. The burger was excellent as were the fries. I kind of felt bad for the server as she appeared to be the only one there waiting on the whole restaurant.

data.title: Pretty Good Burgers, Okay Service, Failed Management (Pro-Tip BYOB)
data.text:
Met up with some friends here for a burger. The food was great, but we went late at night so there was only one server for the entire restaurant! The food was still delivered hot, but we never received refills, and we had to sit around for twenty minutes after everyone was done before our waitress settled our bills.

This is not a staff problem, it is a management problem. Who staffs one server for an entire restaurant EVER? It was unacceptable for us to have to wait as long as we did, but it is also completely cruel to make a server work that hard. In addition, because the server was so overburdened, you know that no one left a tip because they were kept waiting. This is disgraceful treatment of customers and employees. I will not go back until I hear of a policy change.

Pro Tip: The Restaurant is BYOB.

data.title: best burgers by far
data.text: We have visited Mid-City several times and they have the best burgers. Also, their portobella fingers are good either on the salad or appetizer. This place has excellent food. It is not fancy by any means. Clean, but definitely a hole in the wall. Do not let the appearance make you turn around. The food makes this place!

data.title: Give it a try
data.text: Appearances can be deceiving and for Mid City Grill I found that to be true. It doesn't look like much, but the food is really great!  I was expecting basic but the food is beyond basic. Had a grilled chicken sandwich - it had leaf lettuce instead of boring iceberg. Ordered sweet potato fries and they came with chipotle ketchup - nice.  The staff is friendly and attentive. You get good sized portions and won't leave unsatisfied. Try it - you'll like it!

data.title: For the early morning muncher
data.text: This is the place to order from late at night and early morning (until 5:00 am).  We did enjoy their burgers and sweet potato French fries. Huge burger was excellent.

data.title: late night at it's best
data.text: come in from where ever you have been and they are going to bring you some great food..  this place can feed your need for burgers dont forget to bring your own beer, thats right you can bring your own beer!

data.title: Best burgers in town
data.text: We go here at least once a week. Jeff and his staff make the best burgers in town. It's a hole-in-the-wall of the best kind. Fries are hand cut and taste so good!  Wonderful "real" cheesecakes. Fresh homemade garlic hummus with cucumbers and pita points are also great. Even better when Jeff makes hummus with different spices, like black bean and jalapeño.  BYOB. What more could you ask for?

data.title: Burger Heaven
data.text: We had the burgers and fries......................best I have had ever..........true burger genius.  Staff was very friendly as well.

data.title: Awesome Food and Service
data.text: We had not been here in a while but decided to give it a try again. Mid City is located in downtown Johnson City in an older building. They are trying to beef up the downtown so there is some construction in the area. Don't be put off by the building and location. The food is very good and they are creative with their menu; good comfort food and prepared well. We had the grilled tofu sandwich and the un-burger with homemade fries and chips. Both were excellent and not something we can get anywhere else. The fries and chips were not greasy at all. Had the hummus dip to start and it was delicious. Our friends had the burger and the club sandwich and they were very pleased. They give you a big portion so go hungry. Our waitress was very attentive. They do not sell alcohol but allow you to bring it in. They are open from around 5pm - 5am.

data.title: Best burgers and fries
data.text: Mid city has unbeatable cheeseburgers and fresh cut french fries.  The restaurant has a BYOB policy and a very casual atmosphere which works great for a relaxed evening with friends.  They always have a huge selection of homemade cheesecake if it's possible to save room for dessert.

data.title: Late Night Joint with Great Burgers
data.text: This is mainly a light night establishment.  I think they open at 5 pm and close at 5 am, something like that.  In my opinion, however, they have some of the best burgers in town.  They have a different variety of burgers and sandwiches with as much beef as you can handle.  Up to a 2 pounder, I believe.  I'm a big fan of the fries here too.  If you're planning on taking the family, make sure to do so early in the evening.  It can get ugly during the later evening/early morning hours.  It's definitely the place to go after a long evening in downtown JC.  This is not the place to go if you're looking for a fancy, classy restaurant, but if you couldn't care less about they way a place looks (like me) and you love good, filling, comfort food, then this is the place to be.  Also, it is BYOB.

data.title: Stank on Stank
data.text: The food isn't half bad, but that's if your wiiling to deal with the dirty employees and owner. There are pictures of dicks drawn all over the bathroom. The dining area is dirty and smells.

data.title: Owner stuck hands in my food
data.text: Order was wrong and the owner thought he could fix it by sticking his hands in another plate grabbing bacon and throwing it on mine? I've worked in service industry and have never witnessed this or the way he handled it, more or less harassed me. I've been a loyal customer for years having working in the bars surrounding this late night restaurant and am ashamed to say I know the owner by name, thanks for everything Jeff.

data.title: Hole in the wall with FANTASTIC food!
data.text: OPEN LATE! YIPPEE! I have SO enjoyed being able to get great food late at night in JC. The burgers are absolutely the best around: flavorful and juicy! Had the buffalo burger last time. HOLY SMOKES! That thing ROCKS! It was the special that day, and they don't have it very often, but they should put it on the menu permanently.  Don't miss it if you go in and they have it. It's very casual inside, bordering a tiny bit on rundown, but don't let that stop you!
